column4: hello. im having problems with my ubuntu on vmware on my windows box. I can't get the internet connection to work.
nope. i already installed it and everything.
i just can't get a internet connection
what ip address has been assigned to those vmnet hosting linux?
i gave it a static ip of 192.168.0.43.
i gave it already in the network configs in ubuntu
on windoz side, what shows when you  ipconfig /all
my LAN ip as 192.168.0.47.
which one do u want from ipconfig /all
you must respond with a nick as prefixed or else it will be missed
how do i respond with a nick?
you noticed how we put your nick on first?
ok. i got that. anyways. which ipconfig do u want? the lan, vmnet1,vmnet8
does any of the vmnet matches what you set for the ubuntu?
vmnet1, i set it to the same settings for static
to ubuntu
yes. vmnet1 matches
now can you ping from windoz the address of vmnet1 ?
nope. can't ping my router or anything on my window side
then you have to look at your vmware config and make sure they are okay
i've been messing with the vmware network for the past hour. not sure how to fix it their thought
whats is the ip of your windoz and ubuntu again?  also whats set on vmware bridge? nat? host-only?
whats is the ip of your windoz and ubuntu again?  also whats set on vmware bridge? nat? host-only?
